Package cis.project1

Class CanadianSaladModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • cis.project1.CanadianSaladModel
  • public class CanadianSaladModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the "model" class of a Model-View-Controller program. The program simulates the trick-taking card game Canadian Salad. CanadianSaladModel provides game logic, supervised AI representing other players, and scoring.
    Version:
    Summer 2019
    Author:
    Andrew Weston, Christian Thompson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CanadianSaladModel​(java.util.LinkedList<Player> players)
      This constructor creates a CanadianSaladModel object that simulates the trick-taking card game Canadian Salad.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canFollowSuit()
      This method returns whether the current player can follow trump (the Suit of the card that was led).
      void computerPlay()
      This method is a simple AI that represents other (non-user) players.

      This helper method models the dealing of the deck and the players sorting their hands.

      This getter method returns the player whose turn it is.

      This helper method selects a suitable Card to play if a player must follow suit.

      This getter method returns the collection of players.
      Card getThrowOffSuit()
      This helper method selects a suitable Card to play if the player cannot follow suit (does not have any of the trump suit in their hand).

      This helper method gets the player object representing the user.

      This getter method returns the collection of Card objects in the current player's hand.

      This method checks whether it is the first turn of the game.

      This method returns whether the game is finished.

      This method checks whether it is the user's (not a simulated player) turn.

      This method models the passing of the current player's turn.

      This method adds a card to the current trick and passes the turn to the next player.
      void scoreHandNoTricks()
      This method updates the players' scores for a "No Tricks" hand.
      void setCurrentPlayer​(Player p)
      This setter method sets the player whose turn it is.
      protected void setLoserLeadsNextTrick()
      This helper method sets the current player for the next trick to be the loser of the last trick.

      This getter method returns the cards in the current trick.

      • CanadianSaladModel

        public CanadianSaladModel​(java.util.LinkedList<Player> players)
        This constructor creates a CanadianSaladModel object that simulates the trick-taking card game Canadian Salad. The class provides game logic, supervised AI representing other players, and scoring.
        Parameters:
        players - the collection of game players

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.LinkedList<Player> getPlayers()
        This getter method returns the collection of players.
        Returns:
        is the LinkedList representing the game players.

      • isGameComplete

        public boolean isGameComplete()
        This method returns whether the game is finished.
        Returns:
        is true when all players have played all hands.

      • isTrickComplete

        public boolean isTrickComplete()
        This method returns whether the trick is finished.
        Returns:
        is true when all players have played a card.

      • computerPlay

        public void computerPlay()
        This method is a simple AI that represents other (non-user) players. It calls other helper methods to adjust its response.

      • getCurrentTrick

        public Trick getCurrentTrick()
        This getter method returns the current trick.
        Returns:
        is the Trick object representing the most recent trick.

      • trickCards

        public java.util.LinkedList<Card> trickCards()
        This getter method returns the cards in the current trick.
        Returns:
        is the LinkedList of Card objects played in the current trick.

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn()
        This method models the passing of the current player's turn.

      • canFollowSuit

        public boolean canFollowSuit()
        This method returns whether the current player can follow trump (the Suit of the card that was led).
        Returns:
        is true when the current player has a card of the Suit that was led.

      • getLead

        public Card getLead()
        This helper method selects a suitable Card to play first in a new trick.
        Returns:
        is the Card object representing the first card to play.

      • playCard

        public void playCard​(Card card)
        This method adds a card to the current trick and passes the turn to the next player.
        Parameters:
        card - represents the card the player is playing into the trick.

      • isUsersTurn

        protected boolean isUsersTurn()
        This method checks whether it is the user's (not a simulated player) turn.
        Returns:
        is true when it is the user's turn.

      • isFirstTurn

        protected boolean isFirstTurn()
        This method checks whether it is the first turn of the game.
        Returns:
        is true when no player has played a card.

      • getOptimalFollow

        public Card getOptimalFollow()
        This helper method selects a suitable Card to play if a player must follow suit.
        Returns:
        is the Card object representing the a suitable card to play.

      • getThrowOffSuit

        public Card getThrowOffSuit()
        This helper method selects a suitable Card to play if the player cannot follow suit (does not have any of the trump suit in their hand).
        Returns:
        is the Card object representing the first card to play.

        public void deal()
        This helper method models the dealing of the deck and the players sorting their hands.
